etymology.description: phonetic: 文(文) (wén, "literary talent") + semantic: 彡(彡) (shān, "decorative lines") = combination of sound and decorative meaning -> variegated; literary talent
etymology.interpretation: The character 彣(wén) combines the phonetic element 文(文) (wén, "literary talent") with the semantic element 彡(彡) (shān, "decorative lines") to convey both a sound similar to 文(wén) and a meaning related to ornamental qualities, thus associating with variegated and literary talent.

examples.chinese: 他的诗词充满彣采(他的詩詞充滿彣采)，彰显文人风范(彰顯文人風範)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de shīcí chōngmǎn wéncǎi, zhāngxiǎn wénrén fēngfàn.
examples.english: His poetry is full of variegated talent, showcasing his refined literary style.

examples.chinese: 山间的风景色彩彣趣(山間的風景色彩彣趣)，让人流连忘返(讓人流連忘返)。
examples.pinyin: Shānjiān de fēngjǐng sècǎi wénqù, ràng rén liúlián wàngfǎn.
examples.english: The mountain scenery displays variegated charm, making people reluctant to leave.
